awd_titl_txt: IUCRC Planning Grant George Mason University: Center for Wireless Innovation Towards Secure, Pervasive, Efficient and Resilient Next G Networks (WISPER)
awd_abstract_narration:
The proposed Center for Wireless Innovation towards Secure, Pervasive, Efficient, and Resilient Next Generation Networks (WISPER) will coordinate academia, industry, and government to pioneer transformative next generation (NextG) wireless technologies for key industry verticals. Our missions include: (1) growing the U.S. innovation capacity in the next-generation wireless networks; (2) catalyzing breakthrough pre-competitive research for enabling NextG wireless communications; (3) contributing to the emerging North American vision for the next generation wireless networks; (4) providing guidance to standardization bodies and cooperation partners; and (5) producing a workforce prepared to tackle complex next-generation wireless challenges.

WISPER will focus on developing transformative wireless innovations. Areas of research include but are not limited to: (1) exploration of Dynamic Spectrum Sharing and Resource Allocation algorithms  in NextG considering performance, efficiency, resilience, and security and privacy; (2) Secure mmWave Communications with Reconfigurable Intelligent Surfaces;  (3) Reliable mmWave wireless LANs through coordination; (4) development of advanced trust management functionality for virtual networks, trust management and invocation using butterfly keying schemas, trusted computing bases and post- quantum cryptography to support NextG wireless communications; (5) resilient ML-based RAN Slice Management in NextG; and (6) development of an industry-guided workforce development program in the context of next-generation wireless networks. 

The proposed WISPER Center will contribute significantly to the country's future communication infrastructure, with broader impacts on diversity and inclusion, workforce development, and technology transfer. A Diversity & Inclusion Committee will be formed to review the current diversity and inclusion profile and develop specific measures and plans for inspiring the participation of underrepresented groups.  WISPER will prepare students to become proficient in NextG techniques, leading to transformative changes in the state of wireless workforce preparedness. WISPER will enable seamless integration of the center's new discoveries into NextG wireless systems, accelerating technology transfer, enhancing the competence of the industrial members, and contributing to the Nation’s leadership in NextG technologies. 

All data, software, and artifacts produced in this project will be archived and preserved, according to standard institutional security and privacy practices and policies, for at least five years.

This award reflects NSF's statutory mission and has been deemed worthy of support through evaluation using the Foundation's intellectual merit and broader impacts review criteria.

por.por_cntn:
The aim of the planning grant was to pave the way for an NSF IUCRC Center for Wireless Innovation towards Secure, Pervasive, Efficient, and Resilient Next G Networks (WISPER). The grant enabled the PIs to work with a full spectrum of stakeholders to prepare the groundwork for establishing WISPER. The interdisciplinary team, including partners and participants from academics, various industries, and government and military agencies, collaborate to plan a long-term vision and direction for WISPER and identify key research and development thrusts. The planning efforts included the development of the center?s administration structure, management policies and guidelines, marketing plan, future member recruiting plan, and cooperative membership agreement (including membership eligibility, commitment, and intellectual property ownership). The interdisciplinary team also aimed to identify a set of research, education, workforce development, and outreach projects to be carried out during the first two years should the center be established.  On November 2022, a successful WISPER Planning Workshop was held at the Virginia Tech Research Center in Arlington, Va. The workshop saw a total of 85 participants across one and a half days, of which 21 represented 19 prospective member organizations.


Intellectual Merit:  The planned WISPER center focuses on developing transformative wireless innovation towards secure, pervasive, efficient, and resilient next generation wireless networks.  a) exploration of new spectrum bands considering performance, security and privacy, efficiency and coverage; b) integration of artificial intelligence and machine learning in wireless networks for spectrum sensing, allocation, beamforming, waveform design and transceiver design; c) softwarization and virtualization of Next G network functionalities; d) advanced solutions to support resilience, privacy and security in Next G networks; e) demonstration of secure, pervasive, efficient, and resilient connections in diversified industrial applications.


Broader Impacts: The proposed WISPER Center will contribute significantly to the country?s future communication infrastructure, with broader impacts on diversity and inclusion, workforce development, and technology transfer. The center will establish an industry-guided training and workforce development program in the context of next generation wireless networks to prepare students and practitioners with advanced skills to succeed in cutting-edge research and industrial projects. WISPER will enable seamless integration of the center?s new discoveries into the Next G wireless systems, effectively accelerating technology transfer and enhancing the competence of the industrial members. The center will work closely with the prospective Industrial Advisory Board (IAB) and the member universities? technology commercialization offices to increase the penetration to industry and provide guidance and support for filing patent disclosures and fostering spin-off companies to commercialize inventions. It will prepare students and practitioners to become literate and proficient in advanced Next G communication techniques, leading to transformative changes in the state of wireless workforce preparedness. A Diversity & Inclusion Committee will be formed to review the current diversity and inclusion profile and work with the leadership team to develop specific measures and plans for inspiring and improving the participation of underrepresented groups in WISPER.
